Hi:
 It looks like a variation of sahari inlay, though they are usually
entirely flat. 
 AF


>>> jdz@... 07/12/05 12:42 PM >>>
I recently purchased a very large, heavy iron sukashi tsuba, pierced
with Genji mon and straight line, whose surface is mostly covered with
melted shakudo so as to produce the appearance of a puddle or tidal
pool.  I can recall seeing this sort of thing somewhere before, but I
don't remember what school did this sort of thing.  Does this look
familiar to anyone?

David Zincavage

http://zincavage.org/BrownTsuba.html
